verbs.description: circumpose (third-person singular simple present circumposes, present participle circumposing, simple past and past participle circumposed)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To put round; to place around; to place or arrange circularly.
examples: The circumposed air is moved with the Earth.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To place within an encircling space; to pot (a plant).
examples: To Circumpose Trees by planting them in Baskets, Pots, and Boxes, or Cases.
